relation: Configures an IS-IS process for IP on an interface and attaches a tag designator to the routing process.
Enables the IS-IS routing protocol and specifies an IS-IS process.
Displays ES, IS, and M-ISIS neighbors.
Lists the protocol-specific information for each ISO IGRP or IS-IS routing process in the router.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS IP Routing: ISIS Command Reference - Integrated IS-IS Commands: L through V [Support] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description [all] log-adjacency-changes no [all] log-adjacency-changes To configure the router to send a syslog message when an Intermediate System to Intermediate System (IS-IS) neighbor goes up or down, use the log-adjacency-changes command in router configuration mode. To turn off this function, use the no form of this command. log-adjacency-changes (IS-IS) vrf (router configuration) summary-address (IS-IS) srlg spf-interval snmp-server enable traps isis show isis topology show isis spf-log show isis rib redistribution show isis rib show isis nsf show isis neighbors show isis lsp-log show isis ip rib show isis hostname show isis fast-reroute show isis database verbose show isis database show clns traffic show clns is-neighbors show clns interface set-overload-bit set-attached-bit router isis redistribute isis (IPv6) redistribute isis protocol shutdown prc-interval partition avoidance net microloop avoidance rib-update-delay microloop avoidance metric-style wide metric
textAfterTable: Release Modification 10.3T This command was introduced. 12.2(28)SB This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(28)SB. 12.2SX This command is supported in the Cisco IOS Release 12.2SX train. Support in a specific 12.2SX release of this train depends on your feature set, platform, and platform hardware. Usage Guidelines This command allows you to know about IS-IS neighbors going up or down. The log-adjacency-changes command is on by default but only changes generated by IIH events are included, unless the all keyword is also used. Examples The following example configures the router to send a syslog message when an IS-IS neighbor state changes: Device# enable Device# configure terminal Device(config)# router isis ABCD Device(config-router)# log-adjacency-changes all Related Commands
